text:
I am not really into emojis.. also I think they are different between OS so that can be complicated to find a good emoji for all of us :thinking_face:.
So my recomendation is: if you want something visual, I would play with the favicon instead

Well, the update i pushed to beta testers uses both emoji and abbreviated names. It also changes the ordering of the title to be "location|portal|HS" to prevent the location abbreviation from getting lost behind long portal names.

You're right about the Emojis looking visually different on different platforms (though chrome might use it's own set)
If people find they don't like the emojis id first remove them and see if people are satisfied with the abbreviations

As a reminder: if you use the extension and are interested in trying some features before they’re released, we have a beta version. Let us know of any bugs you find and let us know how you feel about the new features.(as with any beta, it should be expected that it’s more prone to instability than the main version of the extension)
<https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/How-to-use-the-Beta-version-of-the-extension>
the debug mode button on the extension isnt working for me, simly just add the `?` to the end and thats it
interesting. Are you using the beta version or normal version?
looks like its working now though
yup, nvrmind must of been a hiccup

hmm, interesting, yea I was just now trying to reproduce the problem. wasn’t able to reproduce it.

Let me know if it happens again. I have a hunch that maybe if the current URL is just right, it could fail.
It tries to detect if you’re currently using debug mode, and if you are it will toggle it off. So my guess is something in that detection might have been awry.
Yea when I first wrote that I remember it not working well if you had an already malformed query string
It is pretty reliant on the query string being formatted correctly
yea i think i had a `?` already on there and it wasnt doing it
